after: Epistemology or theory of knowledge is the branch of philosophy that studies the nature, methods, limitations, and validity of knowledge and belief.

The term "epistemology" is based on the Greek words "ÎµÏÎ¹ÏÏÎ®Î¼Î· or episteme" (knowledge or science) and "Î»ÏÎ³Î¿Ï or logos" (account/explanation). It was introduced into English by the Scottish philosopher James Frederick Ferrier (1808-1864).[1]
